message.content: We refer to external sources on statistics for help. The median is the least sensitive to outliers because it is not influenced by extreme values. The mean can be heavily influenced by outliers, while the mode does not take into account the actual values and is only concerned with frequency. The standard deviation also takes into account the deviation of each value from the mean, which can be heavily influenced by outliers.

We refer to educational resources on statistics for help. The mode is the least sensitive to outliers because it is simply the most frequently occurring value in a dataset and does not take into account the specific values of each data point. The mean and standard deviation are heavily influenced by outliers, while the median is less influenced but still takes into account the specific values of each data point.

The mode is the value that appears most frequently in a dataset and is the least sensitive to outliers as it only reflects the most common value in the data and is not affected by extreme values. The mean and standard deviation are sensitive to outliers, while the median is less sensitive but still affected by extreme values.

We refer to a statistics textbook for help. The median is the middle value, which is less susceptible to outliers compared to the mean, which takes into account every value in the data set. The mode is the most frequently occurring value and is also less sensitive to outliers. The standard deviation takes into account every value and therefore can be greatly affected by outliers. Therefore, the answer is (B) Median.
